MIRO.name: Miro
MIRO.tagline: Enabling teams to collaborate visually on an infinite canvas to bring their ideas to life
MIRO.overview: Miro is a visual collaboration platform (online whiteboard) that enables distributed teams to work effectively together. Founded in 2011 by Andrey Khusid in Russia (now HQ in San Francisco), Miro reached $17.5B valuation in January 2022 after raising $400M Series C. The platform has 90M+ users across 250,000+ organizations, with 99% of Fortune 100 as customers. ARR reached $560M in 2023 with 33% YoY growth. In 2024-2025, Miro acquired Uizard (AI design) and Butter (virtual meetings) and launched the Innovation Workspace—its most significant platform update since founding.

products.name: Miro Boards
products.description: Infinite canvas for visual collaboration, brainstorming, and planning

products.name: Miro Innovation Workspace
products.description: AI-powered workspace for product discovery and innovation (Canvas 2024)

products.name: Miro Diagramming
products.description: Flowcharts, process maps, and technical diagrams

products.name: Miro AI
products.description: AI features for content generation and automation

funding_rounds.investors_html: ICONIQ Growth, Accel, Atlassian, Dragoneer, GIC

MERCURY.name: Mercury
MERCURY.tagline: Providing comprehensive banking services designed specifically for startups and technology companies
MERCURY.overview: Mercury is a business banking platform for startups, founded in 2017 by Immad Akhund, Jason Zhang, and Max Tagher. The company provides checking, savings, treasury, and venture debt through partner banks. Mercury reached $650M ARR in November 2025 with 10 consecutive quarters of GAAP profitability. The company serves 200,000+ businesses with transaction volume of $156B annually. In March 2025, Mercury raised $300M Series C at $3.5B valuation led by Sequoia. CEO Immad Akhund also runs a $26M angel fund.

MIXPANEL.name: Mixpanel
MIXPANEL.tagline: Empowering teams to learn from their data and make better product decisions through analytics
MIXPANEL.overview: Mixpanel is a product analytics platform founded in 2009 by Suhail Doshi and Tim Trefren. The company raised $200M at $1.05B valuation in November 2021 from Bain Capital Tech Opportunities. Revenue grew to $171M in 2024 (up from $145M in 2023). In September 2025, Jen Taylor was named CEO, replacing Amir Movafaghi who took over from founder Suhail Doshi in 2018. Mixpanel serves 8K+ paying customers (29K total) including Netflix, Ticketmaster, Yelp, and Uber. Acquired DoubleLoop in October 2025.

MONZO.name: Monzo
MONZO.tagline: Building a bank that works for everyone with transparent, mobile-first financial services
MONZO.overview: Monzo is the UK's largest digital-only bank, founded in 2015 by Tom Blomfield, Jonas Huckestein, and others. The company pioneered mobile-first banking in the UK with its distinctive coral card. In FY2025, Monzo crossed £1B revenue for the first time (up 48% to £1.2B), with pre-tax profit of £60.5M—its second consecutive profitable year. Customer deposits grew 48% to £16.6B, and one-third of customers now use Monzo as their primary bank. The company is working with Morgan Stanley on a potential £6-7B IPO in H1 2026, with Dublin expansion underway for Europe.

products.name: Current Account
products.description: Fee-free personal banking with instant notifications

products.name: Monzo Premium
products.description: £15/month account with travel insurance and metal card

products.name: Flex
products.description: Buy now, pay later integrated into banking

products.name: Savings Pots
products.description: Easy savings with partner bank rates

highlights.text: Working with Morgan Stanley on IPO (targeting H1 2026)

METROPOLIS.name: Metropolis
METROPOLIS.tagline: AI-powered company transforming the real world with computer vision for checkout-free payment experiences
METROPOLIS.overview: Metropolis is an artificial intelligence company founded in 2017 by CEO Alex Israel and co-founders Travis Kell, Peter Fisher, and Courtney Fukuda in Santa Monica, California. The company is pioneering the "Recognition Economy" by using computer vision and AI to enable seamless, checkout-free payment experiences in the physical world. Starting with parking, Metropolis has revolutionized the industry by automating vehicle recognition and payment processing, eliminating the need for tickets, cards, or apps. As of November 2025, Metropolis has achieved a $5 billion valuation following a $1.6 billion financing round. The company is now the largest parking operator in North America with over 4,200 locations and operations in 40 countries. Metropolis processes more than $5 billion in annual transactions, serves 50 million customers, and adds over 1 million new members monthly. With 23,000+ employees, Metropolis is rapidly expanding beyond parking into retail, hospitality, fueling, and security sectors.

investors.name: Computer Vision Platform: AI-powered system that recognizes vehicles and processes payments automatically without tickets or cards.

MISTRAL-AI.name: Mistral AI
MISTRAL-AI.tagline: European AI champion developing open-source large language models and frontier AI systems
MISTRAL-AI.overview: Mistral AI is a French artificial intelligence startup founded in April 2023 by three former Google DeepMind and Meta researchers. The company specializes in developing open-weight large language models and has rapidly emerged as Europe's leading AI champion. With its flagship chatbot Le Chat and cutting-edge models like Mistral Large and Mixtral, the company has achieved a $14 billion valuation in just over two years. Mistral AI focuses on making frontier AI accessible, transparent, and aligned with European values while competing globally with Silicon Valley giants.

products.name: Le Chat
products.description: Multilingual AI assistant with advanced reasoning and web search

products.name: Mistral Large 2
products.description: Flagship 123B parameter model competing with GPT-4 and Claude

products.name: Mixtral 8x22B
products.description: Open-source mixture-of-experts model with permissive licensing

products.description: Specialized model for software development and coding tasks

products.description: Enterprise AI platform with fine-tuning and deployment tools

MONIEPOINT.name: Moniepoint
MONIEPOINT.tagline: Africa's leading fintech unicorn providing all-in-one banking, payments, and business solutions for SMEs
MONIEPOINT.overview: Moniepoint Inc., formerly known as TeamApt, is a Nigerian fintech unicorn founded in 2015 by Tosin Eniolorunda and Felix Ike. Headquartered in Lagos, Nigeria, with offices in London and Wilmington, Delaware, Moniepoint has become Africa's leading business banking platform serving over 10 million businesses and individuals. The company initially focused on building payment infrastructure for banks before pivoting in 2019 to provide seamless payments, banking, credit, and business management tools directly to micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises. As of October 2025, Moniepoint processes over 1 billion transactions monthly worth more than $250 billion annually, making it Nigeria's largest merchant acquirer. The company achieved unicorn status in October 2024 and is one of the few fintechs globally to reach profitability at unicorn scale while driving financial inclusion across Africa.

highlights.text: Moniepoint continues to grow and expand

investors.name: Moniepoint Business Banking: Comprehensive banking solution for SMEs with digital payments and credit
